description:
Tooltips are small text-only contextual overlays that are triggered by hover/focus. Use anywhere additional explanation might be needed but space is limited on the triggering element. > ### What about 'focusable' elements? > > Content provided to the `renderTip` prop **should not contain any focusable elements**. If you'd like to do > that you should use the [Popover](Popover) component and handle focus management yourself or > consider using a [Modal](Modal) or a [Tray](Tray) as those will work better on smaller screens. #### Uncontrolled Tooltips ```js --- type: example ---

console.log('showing')} onHideContent={() => console.log('hidden')} > Hover or focus me

``` #### Controlled Tooltips ```js --- type: example --- const Example = () => { const [isShowingContent, setIsShowingContent] = useState(false) return ( <>

{ console.log('expecting to show tooltip') }} onHideContent={(e) => { console.log('expecting to hide tooltip') }} > This link has a tooltip

{ setIsShowingContent(event.target.checked) }} /> ) } render() ``` ### Custom elements as renderTrigger Popover and Tooltip attach mouse and focus event listeners to their render trigger components via props. These need to be propagated to the component for the listeners to work: ```js --- type: example --- const MyComponent = forwardRef((props, ref) => { return (
My custom component
) }) ; ``` ### Guidelines ```js --- type: embed --- ```

elementRef.description: provides a reference to the underlying html root element

type.name: signature

value.name: signature
value.raw:
<TriggerProps extends Record<string, any>>(
  props: TriggerProps
) => { 'aria-describedby': string } & TriggerProps

renderTip.description: The content to render in the tooltip

isShowingContent.description: Whether or not the tooltip content is shown, when controlled

defaultIsShowingContent.description: Whether or not to show the content by default, when uncontrolled

as.description: the element type to render as (assumes a single child if 'as' is undefined)

on.description: The action that causes the Content to display (`click`, `hover`, `focus`)

color.description: The color of the tooltip content

placement.description:
Specifies where the Tooltip will be placed in relation to the target element.
Ex. placement="bottom" will render the Tooltip below the triggering element
(Note: if there is not room, it will position opposite. Ex. "top" will
automatically switch to "bottom")

mountNode.description:
An element or a function returning an element to use as the mount node
for the `<Tooltip />` (defaults to `document.body`)

constrain.description:
The parent in which to constrain the tooltip.
One of: 'window', 'scroll-parent', 'parent', 'none', an element,
or a function returning an element

offsetX.description: The horizontal offset for the positioned content

offsetY.description: The vertical offset for the positioned content

positionTarget.description: Target element for positioning the Tooltip (if it differs from children/trigger)

onShowContent.description:
Callback fired when content is shown. When controlled, this callback is
fired when the tooltip expects to be shown

tsType.name: signature

onHideContent.description:
Callback fired when content is hidden. When controlled, this callback is
fired when the tooltip expects to be hidden

preventTooltip.description:
If true, it won't display the tooltip. This is useful in cases when tooltip is conditionally needed
but in an uncontrolled way
